reviews.review:
This is a visually and auditorially satisfying yarn that will have you guessing. It is a masterpiece of video game story telling and all those things other people said.

The above being said there's no reason you shouldn't get this game right now. 

The one down side worth mentioning is the combat and loot system. The former is hampered by the open world nature - you end up with grainy long range combat or close up melee combat so close you can't really tell what you are doing, which some probably consider a quirk of this series. The other issue is the loot system. Again part of the series but the scrounging everywhere for health and coin gets old and breaks immersion.

There is BioShock and Bioshock 2  completely god tier games and then theres Bioshock:Poopoopeepee special edition.

The game is not Bioshock at all besides the wack lore that I bet your going to hate after you go ghost hunting with mom. Theres no reward or feedback when upgrading weapons and the perks are now in some stupid wardrobe you cant even see. The weapons and wizard juices all suck and are uncreative with almost all of them having the same stupid trap system your never going to use. They removed medkit inventory so you can only heal from the bannana you found on some dead guy. Instead of being able to rush or tank through your precisous medkits you saved up you now are playing a duck and cover game waiting for your urine sheild to take a bullet and hit again or you might need to eat another bannana.
DLC more like erectile disfunction my god. They ruined everything every little chance of making it good and just slaped it like a new born ready for the frier. They put freaking stealth missions in bioshock that are manditory in b i o s h o c k. The only two good possible things in this entire game is seeing rapture in HD as a window into a door were they cared about the remakes and being reminded that the dude from Bioshock is wearing a sweater and track pants throughtout the first game.
The thing I hate most is the fact that they put more effort into elizabeth's clothes coming off than the entire game.
This game is so good. one of the best games ever made

Infinite is one of the few games you'll find yourself absolutely lost in. An honest masterpiece; I found it to be one of the best games I've ever played. 

The story, the gameplay, the world building... it's all fantastic. 

If you should buy this game, enjoy your stay - you won't want to leave this one behind.

Exellent jeu.
Gameplay très dynamique.
Durée de vie corecte.
L'histoire est incroyablement bien écrite et pleine de rebondissements.
Un classique à faire absolument .

When I finished BioShock Infinite – don't worry, I won't spoil anything – I was dumbfounded. I wanted to tell someone what I thought, but for a moment I had absolutely no idea. I'd experienced a kind of excited panic, then total delight, then momentary confusion, and then a rush of extraordinary sights, powerful scenes and sudden twists that left me struggling to keep up.
"The plot really does jump the shark. It jumps a lot of sharks. It jumps BioShark Infinisharks"
Infinite is wonderful. Every single person who can play it, should play it. It's a fascinating and gruesomely fun adventure in a genuinely unique, magnificent place. But the plot really does jump the shark. It jumps a lot of sharks. It jumps BioShark Infinisharks. That's not uncommon in cinematic first-person shooters, but I mention it now because the game's mysteries are such a big part of its appeal.
You're on a flying city of magical racists in 1912, and that soon drops to being only the fifth or sixth most puzzling thing about your situation. Who are those two? Why are they talking about me? What's with the giant cyborg bird? What does AD stand for? How does he know... why does she think... when did they... why can I shoot crows from my hands? And how do these pants help me reload?
The intro says you're Booker DeWitt, a private investigator tasked with retrieving a girl named Elizabeth. But I played more like a crazed amnesiac looter, scouring the city for spare change and story clues. In cheerful contrast to the original BioShock's deep-sea madhouse, the flying city of Columbia is still thriving, still beautiful, and still populated – albeit with magical racists. That means it can give you little pieces of these puzzles in more interesting ways, and hoovering them up into a wonky jigsaw is a joy.
"You get to know Columbia as a tourist: a dazzling dream of an impossible city in an impossible place – tranquil, prosperous and happy."
I think it still would have been, even if a tear had opened in the fabric of spacetime and future alterno-Tom, stroking his goatee, had told me that the plot ultimately doesn't add up. So I'm telling you in the hope that you'll still enjoy the process of assembling that wonky jigsaw, without being quite so disappointed when the game itself cuts all the nobbly bits of the pieces so it can cram them together the way it wants to.
Really, it's just a pleasure to have a game this substantial to explore – and one that gives you the breathing room to do so. You still spend a lot of time killing things in BioShock Infinite, but it knows when to give you space. You get to know Columbia as a tourist: a dazzling dream of an impossible city in an impossible place – tranquil, prosperous and happy.
Shops, blocks and districts waft wonkily through the air, listing as they cruise in to dock with each other. Bells chime, children play, locals picnic. There's a fair on, and everyone's out in their 1912 Sunday best. The sun is dazzling, the views are breathtaking, and everyone you meet is chattering happily. As heavy metal clamps lock a tailor's shop in place, I realise the times on the sign outside aren't their opening hours: they're arrivals and departure times.
Your arrival is one of gaming's few truly perfect scenes: a chapel, floors awash with holy water, stone walls echoing with the calming harmony of a gospel choir. Stained glass dioramas flood the space with brilliant gold light, and the heat from a hundred candles creates a gentle haze. The only hint that you're not actually in the afterlife is an occasional, very distant clanking, as some chunk of the city drifts against its restraints. It's more than atmospheric; it's exquisite. That kind of ridiculous artistic flair runs throughout: staggering works of sculpture, transformative use of light, perfectly judged ambience, and music that both nods to the plot and subtly changes the mood. The mileage this game gets out of the song Will The Circle Be Unbroken alone – all four times it's used – deserves some kind of award.
"Your arrival is one of gaming's few truly perfect scenes"
Columbia is a less restrictive setting than BioShock's Rapture, and each district has a different vibe. That makes your adventure through it fascinating, and each new area exciting to discover. Even close to the end, you're visiting remarkable new places with radically different moods.
I keep wanting to say that it's 'directed' brilliantly, the elements fit together so well. But that's not the right word, because the other thing it does well is keeping you in control. There are no cutscenes, no switching to third person, no agency-limiting tropes like mounted gun sections. The few times you're not free to move are generally when your character physically wouldn't be.
Maintaining that respect for the player, even when you need to tell a character-driven story, is a rare and wonderful thing. Like Half-Life 2, Infinite doesn't feel like a game made by frustrated filmmakers. It feels like a game made by people who know how to make films, and decided to make something else.
Early on, the times when combat does break out are the low points. There seems to have been some internal rule against adding any exotic weapons, so Infinite's guns stick religiously to convention: pistols, shotguns, three types of machinegun, rifles, grenade launchers and a rocket launcher. None of them let you choose an ammo type the way BioShock did, and only the revolver and shotguns are really satisfying to use. Those aren't available in the early fights, when guns are your primary tools.

It gets better the more you drink. You acquire magical abilities by downing Vigors, which come in beautiful custom bottles relating to what they do. A lot of the early ones just let you disable and damage a group of enemies – by swarming them with crows, setting fire to them, or floating them into the air. But they get more interesting.
"There seems to have been some internal rule against adding any exotic weapons, so Infinite's guns stick religiously to convention"
Charge lets you dash to a group of enemies and hit them with explosive force. Return to Sender absorbs incoming damage while you hold the button, then releases it as a projectile when you let go. Undertow can knock enemies back with a wave of water – often the end of your day, in a flying city. Or you can hold the button down to reach out with Donnie Darko-style tendrils and yank distant snipers to your doorstep. The water even holds them still while you line up a headshot.
Some of them form natural combos: soaking wet Undertow victims are really hoping that you're not going to- oh, you're electrocuting them before they can get up, classy. Enemies currently being pecked to death would like to request that you don't set the crows... well, they're on fire now, but for future reference.
There are only eight Vigors, and they're all free when you find them. You only specialise when you buy upgrades: expensive but significant perks for each, some of which introduce new rules.
I wasn't wild about Murder of Crows until I bought the perk that creates a nest every time someone dies during the pecking process. If anyone steps on it, that nest erupts in a new flock of crows. If anyone dies during that crow storm, you get new nests! Plenty of fights involve new waves of enemies flooding into the same area, and this self-perpetuating cycle of flapping and screaming and dying is a guilty pleasure.
You can tweak your abilities a little more with Gear – like the aforementioned pants that mysteriously help you reload. I also carry three magical hats, two spare shirts, a spare pair of shoes, and I've now upgraded to pants that make me explode when I land from a great height.
The system is insane and wildly incongruous, but it does allow for some entertaining configurations. If someone walks into one of my crow traps, I can then land on them to set the crows ablaze. If they try to hit me, my hat electrocutes them. And by
Deze game is fantastisch. Een hele hoop fantasie samen in een shooter for fun. Het is soms een beetje creepy en de beelden zijn overweldigend. Het is echt een uniek spel. Echt een aanrader!

Es de esos juegos que terminan marcando al jugador, con un final que te deja un terrible vacío dentro tuyo. 

Recomiendo al 100% comprarlo junto a toda la saga y sus respectivos dlcs.

So, I am a gamer, and mostly I like FPS games. But I really hate single player FPS games. But this game is different. I bought this game because of summer sale event. Where all games are discount. Well when I see this game, the rating was so good, so I curious what make this game good. So I bought this game and play it. So, for the first 3 hour I feel that I could not stop playing this game until I forget my dinner. and the second day I play for 4 hours until I forget my lunch. What I get in this game is addictively-fun. Once you play it you cant stop it, but you can stop it if you're not a type of person like me that like to forget stuff xD. So the game it so worth to buy. Love it! (Sorry bad Grammar)

“文艺至死”恐怕是我能想到的唯一一个能够形容《生化奇兵：无限》这部堪称第九艺术典范的作品的形容词了。

游戏开始，玩家控制的主角布克（Booker）受人委托去寻找一位名叫伊丽莎白（Elizabeth）的女孩儿，以免除自己欠下的债务。当布克进入灯塔，冲入高耸的云霄，之后随之而来的一连串疯狂却又美丽、压抑又不失温情的故事也开始慢慢抓住了玩家的心。

《生化奇兵：无限》在常见的反乌托邦基础上引入了宗教理念，以致于游戏中的天空之城哥伦比亚（Columbia），真的几乎成为了一座理想国。而在这款游戏中，它无论是名字还是起源，毫无疑问都是影射的美国。

在先知（The Prophet）的领导下，人们看似安居乐业，但真相却是先知以白人至上主义建设的哥伦比亚，成了白人的天堂，有色人种的地狱，而白人居民在先知的宗教宣传下却对此种现象不以为然。当异乡人布克闯进这个“桃源乡”，当他把被人们称为“先知的子嗣”的伊丽莎白从囚禁中释放，这座罪恶之城也将迎来她的终结，而至于布克和伊丽莎白二人，也将逐渐揭开自己过去被蒙蔽的身世，迎接无法改变的悲惨命运。

正如开头所描述的，整个游戏都围绕着“文艺至死”这个主题而创作，无论是画面、操作还是游戏创意。玩家可以在美轮美奂的哥伦比亚街头流连忘返，也可以对复古的蒸汽朋克风格飞艇与机械啧啧赞叹；可以在战斗中使用各自心仪的各式武器，也可以另走偏锋，用法术来出奇制胜。得益于制作组对这些细节的精心打磨，我们在了解剧情的同时也能获得不错的游戏体验。

当然，最令人印象深刻又不舍其离去的，还要属这位“大家的女儿”——伊丽莎白。在游戏中，她负责担当玩家的队友，能为你拉开各式时空裂隙来提供辅助补给，也能在你生命濒危、缺蓝时及时向你抛出药品。如此的高度智能化与其他游戏中的猪队友高下立见。随着后续剧情的一步步推进与深入，玩家在了解故事背景、心疼伊丽莎白的同时也逐渐越来越离不开她。

在故事的结尾，伊丽莎白带布克穿越过无限个灯塔，使布克终于回忆起过去的一切。先知与布克是位于不同时空位面的同一人，而频繁出现的那条洗礼用的小溪则是这两个或者同一个人的分界点。布克因为穿越时空的次数过多而丧失了生育能力，便从另一个位面负债累累的布克那里买下了他的女儿，也就是后来出现的伊丽莎白。玩家扮演的布克在穿越时空后目睹这一切而反悔交出女儿，导致伊丽莎白的小指被时空裂隙切断，但伊丽莎白也因此获得了控制时空的能力。最终怀揣着对女儿亏欠的愧疚，布克选择了洗礼，亦或是说不同位面的伊丽莎白强迫布克完成了洗礼。洗礼完成后，伊丽莎白消失，布克在自己房间里醒来，他立刻前去查看婴儿房里的伊丽莎白是否还在，故事却在这里戛然而止，留给玩家无限的想象空间。

这一切的一切，在集结全部线索后终于一目了然，却又复杂纷呈，每个人心中都有一个对此解释最完美的结局。同时在体验过云端激战与海葬DLC后，生化奇兵3部曲也真正地串联在了一起；加上本作开放式的结局使它可以在玩家臆想中不断地循环往复、重新排列组合，这恰恰又呼应了本作的副标题：无限。

Hayatımda oynadığım en iyi ikinci oyun serisi olan Bioshock serisi'nin üçüncü oyunu Bioshock İnfinite, Dishonored'dan sonra en sevdiğim oyundur. Oyunu şiddetle tavsiye ederim, ama sonu birazda olsa üzücü. Oyun'nun bitmek bilmeyen aksiyonu ve muhteşem grafikleri ile tam anlamıyla bir şaheserdir. Fiyatı 50 TL ama indirimlerle 12 TL'ye bile düşebiliyor.

Что же этот обзор я затянул, и теперь говорить об игре в рамках текущего года (2019),игра не самая лучшая, но и не худшая, 3ая часть собрала все достоинства прошлых и обзавелась своими, сама серия Bioshock себя прославила на равне с другими не менее знаменитыми сериями игр, да игра по факту линейная, но нам тут не задают жёсткий трафик, с самого начала мы можем походить и посмотреть летучий город Каламбия, не путать со страной. Про сложность на макс. Сложности в моментах было легко, пока не появляются мини и просто боссы, графика--вот тут  замечание, все хорошо, но где все эти шейдеры?! Почему нету их когда смотришь на грудь Елизабет, вот реально втык разработчики вам за это(и да смотреть через оптику снайперки данную ситуацию не улучшит=) 😛) в целом игра по моему мнению 8.5 из 10. УДАЧИ, ИГРАЙТЕ ТОЛЬКО В ХОРОШИЕ ИГРЫ.

Bioshock Infinite, una obra de arte bellísima. Llevando la narrativa a lugares ocultos (recomiendo buscar todas las cintas), con un mecánicas innovadoras, llegando a sentir los momentos de lucha en el aire como un "plataformas/hack & slash". La saga Bioshock nos sorprende con cada nueva entrega, espero ansiosamente una nueva entrega para poder explorar un nuevo mundo, donde sea que este la próxima vez.

游戏流程并不算长，满打满算不到10小时通关。
刚玩时一直在关注伊丽莎白，后来则开始沉迷于剧情，但打完之后才意识到伊丽莎白才是整个游戏的精髓。
她很独立自强，不像艺术作品中的常见小女孩。最后通关了，明明布克和她是父女关系，却有种朋友一般的感情。
海葬还没开始打，光是无限之城就足够回味的了。
最后吐槽一下，厂家为什么不给伊丽莎白留个好结局（通过被剧透得知海葬剧情），至少出个生化奇兵4我也会上车。这对于艺术品的塑造是很完美的，但是玩家很不爽！！
希望我能带你坐上前往巴黎的飞艇
컴스탁이 없다면 안나 드윗이 엘리자베스 컴스탁이 되는 일도 없기에 컴스탁의 존재를 없애버리는것은 결국 엘리자베스의 소멸을 의미했다. '부커 드윗과 엘리자베스 컴스탁'은 이제 없다...슬프다...

Certainly worth buying on sale. Looks really nice and is very fun but I would only buy on sale because of high price and how old it is.

This game is a quintessential example of the games with interesting plots that are badly executed. Bioshock Infinite is not the Bioshock game you are familiar with but a brand new feel to the controls and the mechanics is always a welcome move.  Although, I don't dig it's Call of Duty - like shooting style. The game is well written through and though and it pays off at the very end. STUPID EXPLANATIONS AT THE VERY END HAVE KILLED MY INTEREST COMPLETELY!!!!! I'd still want you to play and experience Columbia.

First off, I have to say that the game has a great story and a really good atmosphere. My main issue with the game is the combat system, which I found to be very boring. At first, I started the game on hard difficulty as I usually like a challenge, but halfway through the game I was bored and felt like the difficulty was not rewarding. To survive, you have to play slow and shoot one enemy at a time as you're being shot from different directions. It felt like playing a call of duty campaign, which I think has a boring combat system too. I switched the difficulty to easy and rushed passed the enemies as killing them felt like a waste of my time. The problem is, that didn't even work most of the time because in order to unlock the doors, I had to be out of combat, so I had to look for all the enemies in the area and kill them before proceeding.

TL;DR
Really good story and atmosphere.
Very boring and repetitive combat.

falta palavras pra descrever esse jogo, eu diria incrível mas mesmo assim é pouco. Do início ao fim esse game te prende, eu passei quase 10 fucking horas seguidas jogando e não cheguei nem perto de cansar. Meu jogo favorito de todos os tempos, com toda certeza

게임 설명
캐주얼 슈팅 게임입니다.
어떠한 목적으로 천공도시 콜럼비아에 온 부커 드윗이 되어 여인을 구출하고 일련의 스토리를 진행합니다.
주인공은 비커라는 물약을 통해서 염분으로 초능력을 사용할 수 있습니다.
초능력을 결합한 총술로 적들을 죽이며 앞으로 나아가는 게임입니다.
리뷰
스토리가 역대급으로 충격적입니다.
엔딩을 보는 순간 모든 실낱의 이야기가 한 줄로 딱 이어집니다.
저도 스트리밍으로 엔딩을 본 후 '아, 이런 게임에는 돈을 지불해야 해!' 라고 생각하여,
사실상 스토리가 지분 85% 정도는 먹고 가는 게임인데도 불구하고 구매했습니다.
只能说不愧是第九艺术
Bitmesin diye az az oynuyorum.

Perfecta ambientación, personajes muy interesantes, historia que no te deja despegarte ni un momento.
Con los DLC´s te atrapa aún mas.

Oyunu çıktıktan 6 sene sonra oynasam bile yapay zekası günümüzdeki bazı oyunlara taş çıkartır derecede iyi. Hikayeyi anlatmaya çalışamam o kadar güzel ki bazen hemen düşmanları öldürsem de hikayenin devamını öğrensem diye hızlı hızlı düşmanlarla çatıştım :D indirimde kesinlikle alın oynayın derim. Finali ise oyunun en çok sevdiğim yeri oldu. Oyunu boktan bir son ile bitirmemişler.

Immer noch eins meiner absoluten Lieblingsspiele!

Eine unfassbar spannende und interessante Story, nices Geballer (zugegeben nach einer Zeit etwas repetetiv, aber meiner Meinung nach geht es hier mehr um die Geschichte der beiden Hauptfiguren) und eine wunderschöne, abwechslungsreiche und lebendige Spielwelt. Auch nach den Jahren immer noch eine mega Empfehlung: Wer es noch nicht kennt, jetzt aber nachholen!

This is a good game,  yes. 

But it pales to the other bioshock games, I played all bioshock games back to back and am currently playing this one.

This one enemies are like a hive-mind unlike the first 2, and things seem to be dumb down. This game seems to focus more on the story but didn't give as much time to the game-play, don't get me wrong they innovate just not as much as the older bioshocks. So this may not be the best introduction.

I would say this game is worth your time but if compared to another bioshock you should go with the other.
Сюжет просто великолепный, и концовка оставляет уйму эмоций.

Hikaye anlatımı konusunda her ne kadar iyi olmasa da oyunun hikayesi zekice hazırlanmış ve güzel. Oynanış ise vaadedilenden çok farklı ama idare eder. İndirimdeyken almanızı öneririm.
以前买过X360的盗版，但玩了一个小时就卡碟了，之后就再也读不出来了。。。不过现在来玩还不算落伍，因为这是个很优秀的作品，场景非常漂亮并具有想象力，它让我们看到了艺术也可以用游戏来展现出来，希望有生之年还能看见同样优秀的续作或电影，推荐给喜欢剧情或喜欢蒸汽朋克的玩家

Wow. I think I liked Bioshock Infinite even more than Bioshock 1 +2. 
I did not think this would have been possible because I LOVED 1 and 2 so much.
This game is just so great that you will definitely love it if you like the first 2 at all.
I really hope another Bioshock game is created someday. I would buy it right away.

Прошел второй раз, спустя 2.5 года. В первый раз эмоции били через край, второй раз было чуть менее ярко. И все же - игра потрясающая. Придумать такой наркоманский сюжет, и чтобы он понравился..сценарист заслужил свой хлеб. Боевка проста, и тем не менее - это чуть ли не единственный шутер, который я прошел с удовольствием. Элизабет - одна из лучших союзниц-напарников, прекрасно ее прописали. Стрелять весело и просто, жаль, что с собой таскать можно не больше двух пушек. Оружие можно  улучшать, система с супер способностями прикольная, хоть мне понравилось использовать лишь одну-две из них. Авторы игры молодцы - разбавляют стрельбу диалогами с Лиз, в игре полно интересных сценок. 
Помню, когда играл в первый раз в игре были два неплохих дополнения. Их тоже советую заценить тем, кому понравился Инфинит.

作为一款单机游戏，在我看来只有2个方面可以打动玩家的心，一个是游戏性，另一个就是叙事性。(群嘲一波美末2)
而生化奇兵无限将这两者完美的糅合在了一起，
游戏性方面作为一款2003年的游戏，虽无法再与2020年的华丽大作们拼画面和玩法，但作为一个FPS突突突游戏完全是合格的。
叙事性方面更是无敌，从一开始的追踪敌人，解救小女孩，到玩家满脑疑惑的一路探寻，再到最后的解开身世，豁然开朗，剧情环环相扣，紧紧抓着玩家的心，着实让我惊艳无比。

感谢这14个小时的陪伴，感谢伊丽莎白的救赎。
